meanings.definition: Connected to the ground or a conductor that serves as a ground.
meanings.sent1: The metal rod was earthed to prevent any electrical accidents.
meanings.sent2: The house had an earthed wire to ensure safety during thunderstorms.
meanings.sent3: The earthed wire decided it was tired of being shocked all the time.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor was like an earthed connection, always stable and secure.
meanings.sent5: The earthed plug hummed softly, a constant reminder of safety.

meanings.definition: Covered or mixed with soil or dirt.
meanings.sent1: The earthed path through the forest was cool and damp.
meanings.sent2: The earthed garden beds were ready for planting in the spring.
meanings.sent3: The earthed shoes left muddy prints all over the clean floor.
meanings.sent4: Her hands, earthed from gardening, felt a connection to the earth itself.
meanings.sent5: The earthed roots of the tree reached deep into the soil for nourishment.
